definition[0]: to write something on a piece of paper
example[0]: This is the address. Do you want to write it down?
definition[1]: to officially say that a debt no longer has to be paid, or officially accept that you cannot get back money you have spent or lost
definition[2]: to reduce the value of an asset as shown in a company’s accounts
example[1]: The giant hospital chain said it will write down about $100 million in assets and reserves.
definition[3]: when the value of an asset as shown in a company’s accounts is reduced
example[2]: The charge includes $2.7 million from the write-down of assets.
